precheck.title: DPIA Pre-Check
precheck.description: Quick assessment to determine if a full DPIA is required for your processing activity.

questions.q1: Will your processing involve systematic and extensive evaluation of personal aspects relating to natural persons?
questions.q2: Will your processing involve large scale processing of special categories of data or data relating to criminal convictions?
questions.q3: Will your processing involve systematic monitoring of publicly accessible areas on a large scale?
questions.q4: Will your processing involve new technologies or innovative applications?
questions.q5: Will your processing prevent data subjects from exercising their rights or accessing services?
questions.q6: Will your processing involve profiling or automated decision-making with legal or significant effects?
questions.q7: Will your processing involve vulnerable data subjects (children, employees, patients)?
questions.q8: Will your processing involve cross-border transfers outside the EU/EEA?

results.required: DPIA Required - Your processing activities indicate a high risk to individuals' rights and freedoms.
results.recommended: DPIA Recommended - While not strictly required, a DPIA would be beneficial for your processing activities.
results.notRequired: DPIA Not Required - Your processing activities appear to be low risk, but consider conducting a DPIA if circumstances change.

contextGuide.title: Context Module Guide
contextGuide.description: The Context module provides comprehensive data mapping and infrastructure management for GDPR compliance. It helps you understand where your data lives, how it flows, and who has access to it across your entire organization.
contextGuide.purposeDescription: Context represents 25% of your compliance score and serves as the foundation for all other privacy assessments. It provides the essential infrastructure mapping required for GDPR Article 30 compliance and data protection impact assessments.

step1.title: Start with IT Systems
step1.description: Begin by cataloging all IT systems that process personal data. This forms the foundation for all other mappings.

tasks.add: Add all applications, databases, and services
tasks.classify: Classify criticality levels (low, medium, high, critical)
tasks.assign: Assign system owners and technical contacts

step2.title: Document Processing Activities
step2.description: Create your GDPR Article 30 Record of Processing Activities (ROPA) by linking business processes to systems.

tasks.define: Define processing purposes and lawful basis
tasks.set: Set review dates and DPO requirements

step3.title: Register Vendors & Processors
step3.description: Maintain a registry of all third-party processors and vendors with access to personal data.

tasks.classify: Classify vendor roles (processor, joint controller, etc.)
tasks.track: Track DPA agreements and expiration dates
tasks.monitor: Monitor vendor locations and contact details

step4.title: Map Data Flows
step4.description: Track how personal data moves between systems, vendors, and jurisdictions.

tasks.document: Document data flow directions and endpoints

step5.title: Define Locations & Jurisdictions
step5.description: Establish geographic context for data processing locations and adequacy decisions.

qualityTips.review: Set regular review cycles for all data

missingDpa.title: Missing DPA Agreements
missingDpa.solution: Solution: Review vendor list regularly, prioritize processors with access to sensitive data, establish DPA templates for common vendor types.

incompleteMapping.title: Incomplete Data Flow Mapping
incompleteMapping.solution: Solution: Start with high-risk/high-volume flows first, involve IT teams in discovery, use network diagrams and existing documentation as reference.

outdatedActivities.title: Outdated Processing Activities
outdatedActivities.solution: Solution: Set quarterly review schedules, involve data protection officers in reviews, link business process changes to ROPA updates.
